blog.name: ifyoulikepinacoladas31000
blog.title: Yes I like Pina Coladas!!!
blog.description: French, bi, 25, Warlock, chaotic good (apparently), Ravenclaw, Thunderbird, INTJ (or INFP) performer in a musical theatre group. Messy blog, just like my mind and my bedroom.💗💜💙

summary: Critical Role ep 115
body:
Critical Role ep 115

Keyleth: I’ll find you. I promise. I’ll see you again.

Vax: I’ll never be that far away.

Keyleth: Forever.

Vax: And ever and always.

So yeah. Vax is not going to get out of his deal with the Raven Queen. I’m disheartened. I feel so much sorrow right now, it’s horrible.

summary: For the 2500 follow fic request: In the Not-so-terribly-distant Future the m9 Bring Molly back to life. Everyone is at least a...
question: For the 2500 follow fic request: In the Not-so-terribly-distant Future the m9 Bring Molly back to life. Everyone is at least a little bit different from how he last remembers them, but that's to be expected considering its been a fair bit of time since he last saw them, but He's adjusting. One of those difference sticks out to him the most though. (you decide who and what!)
answer:
(you come into my home and you make me have Emotions??? Shame on you (and thank you SO much 💜))

• • •

It goes like this:

He sees it in Beau first, in the way her eyes well up as he’s pulled from the grave, in the way her arms tense as she throws herself around his shoulders, in the way her voice cracks when she narrows her eyes and shakes her head and says: oh, gods. Fuck you.

It lacks bite. It lacks her usual malice.

Nott’s change is more subtle. She seems to know exactly who to steal from, exactly when, and doesn’t hide as much from the group anymore. She still holds her opinions proud and high, but when Molly asks her, as a joke, as they stare into his open grave, if she still wants to learn about his past, she just sighs and says: only if you do.

He doesn’t. She respects that.

Jester’s poking and teasing is lighter, not as silly. She asks if he needs healing and she asks if he’s alright, and that night, before they enter the tavern, she pulls him back and whispers in Infernal that he shouldn’t strain himself, he should be careful, that if there’s a fight he should take a step back and let them deal with it. We’ve gotten a lot of practice! We’re super-tough now, it’s pretty cool.

It is pretty cool. Molly has to agree with that. 

Caleb calls him over before bed, as they stand before the inn’s crackling hearth. He reaches a hand into his shirt and Molly raises his eyebrows with a tease on his lips, before it suddenly dies and Caleb’s standing there, holding the periapt, clutching the ruby crystal between his fingers. You should have this back, Mister Mollymauk. Your safety is more important than mine.

That’s not how he remembers it. He takes the heart into his hands. 

Fjord insists that Molly have the bed. He insists he will sleep on the floor. Molly asks if they aren’t going to squabble for the mattress like they always do, if they aren’t going to compare their complaints. Fjord laughs. Fjord shakes his head, starts setting up his bedroll. You were dead, today, Mol. You’ve been dead. I ain’t gonna make you sleep on the ground.

Molly jokes that he’s been sleeping there already, he’s gotten used to it just fine, and Fjord’s expression immediately fills with grief. He stops, and turns away.

(And there’s this new guy, this new member. He’s colorful, very tall. And in the very next battle, he lifts a single finger and summons forth a holy storm of green fire and emerald flame, tilts his staff just slightly and conjures a swarm of flesh-eating insects, without even taking a single step forward.

His name is Caduceus Clay. They told me all about you, nice to see you up on your feet.)

And when they stumble across her at the edge of a forest clearing, when they see her silhouetted against the dawn with her sword at her side, when they catch her, shout her name, when her eyes go wide and she drops her bag and she rushes forward and throws herself against Molly, when he grins into her shoulder and buries his fingers in her hair, when she holds him so tight he could never let go, when they both cry so hard that Molly’s laughter starts to taste like salt—

—he pulls back, and realizes that she hadn’t changed in the slightest.

You didn’t move on, he murmurs. You’re supposed to move on.

She shakes her head. She lays a hand on his chest. How could I, Mollymauk? I never even got to say goodbye.

And somehow, somehow, despite all that he’d missed, despite every second he’d been gone, despite everything he no longer knew about his friends and everything he couldn’t accept about himself, hearing her say this, say those words— 

—that was the worst thing of all. 

• • •

(For anyone who’d like a request filled, check out this post and ask away! I’ve also made a Ko-Fi, if you’re feeling generous! 💜)
answer_abstract:
(you come into my home and you make me have Emotions??? Shame on you (and thank you SO much 💜))

• • •

It lacks bite. It lacks her usual malice.

She still holds her opinions proud and high, but when Molly asks her, as a joke, as they stare into his open grave, if she still wants to learn about his past, she just sighs and says: only if you do.

He doesn’t. She respects that.

He sees it in Beau first, in the way her eyes well up as he’s pulled from the grave, in the way her arms tense as she throws herself around his shoulders, in the way her voice cracks when she narrows her eyes and shakes her head and says: oh, gods. Fuck you.

It lacks bite. It lacks her usual malice.

Nott’s change is more subtle. She seems to know exactly who to steal from, exactly when, and doesn’t hide as much from the group anymore. She still holds her opinions proud and high, but when Molly asks her, as a joke, as they stare into his open grave, if she still wants to learn about his past, she just sighs and says: only if you do.

He doesn’t. She respects that.
